net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data

Interface ListSelectionModel

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ListSelectionModelImpl

    public interface ListSelectionModel
    Interface for holding selections based on a list.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addListSelectionListener(ListSelectionListener l)
      Add a listener for selection events.
      void clearSelection()
      Clears all selections.
      int getActiveListenerCount()
      Get the number of listeners for this object that do not implement the PassiveListener interface.
      int getAnchorSelectionIndex()
      Get the anchor selection index, this is set and defined by the class using this object.
      int getLeadSelectionIndex()
      Get the lead selection index, the last index selected.

      Get the number of listeners for this object.

      Get the maximum index selected.

      Get the minimum index selected.

      Get the selection mode.

      Determine if the selection value is changing.

    • Method Detail

      • addListSelectionListener

        void addListSelectionListener(ListSelectionListener l)
        Add a listener for selection events.
        Parameters:
        l - The listener.

      • clearSelection

        void clearSelection()
        Clears all selections.

      • getActiveListenerCount

        int getActiveListenerCount()
        Get the number of listeners for this object that do not implement the PassiveListener interface.
        Returns:
        int greater than or equal to zero.

      • getAnchorSelectionIndex

        int getAnchorSelectionIndex()
        Get the anchor selection index, this is set and defined by the class using this object. isSelectionEmpty() should be used to determine if there are no selections.
        Returns:
        int greater than or equal to zero, or -1 if there is no selection.

      • getLeadSelectionIndex

        int getLeadSelectionIndex()
        Get the lead selection index, the last index selected. isSelectionEmpty() should be used to determine if there are no selections.
        Returns:
        int greater than or equal to zero, or -1 if there is no selection.

      • getListenerCount

        int getListenerCount()
        Get the number of listeners for this object.
        Returns:
        int greater than or equal to zero.

      • getMaxSelectionIndex

        int getMaxSelectionIndex()
        Get the maximum index selected. isSelectionEmpty() should be used to determine if there are no selections.
        Returns:
        int greater than or equal to zero, or -1 if there is no selection.

      • getMinSelectionIndex

        int getMinSelectionIndex()
        Get the minimum index selected. isSelectionEmpty() should be used to determine if there are no selections.
        Returns:
        int greater than or equal to zero, or -1 if there is no selection.

      • getSelectionMode

        ListSelectionMode getSelectionMode()
        Get the selection mode.
        Returns:
        ListSelectionMode.

      • getValueIsAdjusting

        boolean getValueIsAdjusting()
        Determine if the selection value is changing.
        Returns:
        true if the selections are still changing or false if the selections can be considered stable.

      • insertIndexInterval

        void insertIndexInterval(int index,
                       int length,
                       boolean before)
        Insert an index interval at the index and move all intervals following the insert down (increase the indicies).
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the new interval.
        length - The length of the new interval, should be greater than zero.
        before - true to insert the interval before the interval at interval, or false to insert after index.

      • isSelectedIndex

        boolean isSelectedIndex(int index)
        Determine if the index is selected.
        Parameters:
        index - The index to check, must be greater than or equal to zero.
        Returns:
        true if the index is selected.

      • isSelectionEmpty

        boolean isSelectionEmpty()
        Determine if the selection is empty.
        Returns:
        true if there are no selections.

      • removeIndexInterval

        void removeIndexInterval(int index0,
                       int index1)
        Remove an index interval, adjusting the indicies for selection intervals accordingly.
        Parameters:
        index0 - The beginning of the selection interval, inclusive.
        index1 - The end of the selection interval, inclusive.

      • removeListSelectionListener

        void removeListSelectionListener(ListSelectionListener l)
        Remove a listener for selection events.
        Parameters:
        l - The listener.

      • removeSelectionInterval

        void removeSelectionInterval(int index0,
                           int index1)
        Remove a selection interval, does not adjust any other intervals.
        Parameters:
        index0 - The beginning of the selection interval, inclusive.
        index1 - The end of the selection interval, inclusive.

      • setAnchorSelectionIndex

        void setAnchorSelectionIndex(int index)
        Set the anchor index, defined by the class using this object. The anchor index will be set to -1 when the selection is cleared.
        Parameters:
        index - The anchor selection index.

      • setLeadSelectionIndex

        void setLeadSelectionIndex(int index)
        Set the lead index, defined by the class using this object. The lead index will be set to -1 when the selection is cleared.
        Parameters:
        index - The lead selection index.

      • setSelectionInterval

        void setSelectionInterval(int index0,
                        int index1)
        Set the selection interval, does not remove other selected intervals.
        Parameters:
        index0 - The beginning of the selection interval, inclusive.
        index1 - The end of the selection interval, inclusive.

      • setSelectionMode

        void setSelectionMode(ListSelectionMode selectionMode)
        Set the selection mode.
        Parameters:
        selectionMode - The new selection mode, must not be null.

      • setValueIsAdjusting

        void setValueIsAdjusting(boolean valueIsAdjusting)
        Set a flag to determine if the selection is changing.
        Parameters:
        valueIsAdjusting - true if the selections are still expected to change, false if the selections can be considered stable.
